column4: hello, i'm still having trouble getting svideo out to work with my nvidia card. i used the following url: http://download.nvidia.com/XFree86/Linux-x86/1.0-8762/README/appendix-g.html
would someone be willing to look at my xorg.conf to see if i've done it right?
would you give me the url to pastebin?
!info pastebin
!pastebin
!tell ray__ about pastebin
hmmm
pastebin it and we'll have a look.
mmmm no v4l in the modules ?
v4l?
what is v4l? i've never heard of that
i'm not 'sure' you need v4l to get that to work.   but  apt-cache search v4l
was v4l not an option in the modules section of your config ?
that doesn't seem to be what i need. nvidia drivers should work just fine
other than the missing v4l  i don't see any thing that looks  amiss
say i dl'ed v4l-conf, would i specify something in xorg.conf myself?
and like i said.  i don't know that you need it,  but you can try adding    section "Module"   load  v4l
one more question: everytime i save the xorg.conf file, do i have to restart?
issue  sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
yeah tty7 is the default location for X
alt+left-arrow  is a surefire way to find a running X from the console.... it switches one tty left each press.
